article_node.title: Pair of Immigration Raids Disrupt a New Jersey Shipping Hub
article_node.summary:
A maze of warehouses wind through this New Jersey suburb, where highways assure easy access to New York City and beyond.

In Edison, thousands of immigrant workers toil in hundreds of warehouses, sorting millions of boxes arriving from nearby ports before being sent by trucks across the United States. But this summer has delivered something else.

Immigration raids a few weeks apart at two warehouses have unsettled the daily rhythms of this busy corridor, where Amazon, FedEx and UPS have a large...
